More editing tips: “most” can usually replace “majority of.” Stop saying “as well as” when you mean “and.” 
”In order to” can usually be “to,” ”upon” can usually be “on,” and “utilize” can usually be “use.” Diseases are diagnosed, not people. “Try to” not “Try and.”
